title: [Feature Request] Zoom / Presentation mode
author: ruslanbes
body_snippet:
Sometimes I use the mRemoteNG to demonstrate things and the problem I'm facing is that the font is too small and nearly impossible to read on TV screens or projectors.

I tried the Windows Magnifying glass, but it's not very convenient and the screen sharing app we use (coincidentally called "Zoom") doesn't support that.

It would be very useful to have a zoom feature like in IDEs and browsers: Zoom In/Out by Ctrl+ / Ctrl- (or Ctrl + Scroll). It's implemented simply by changing font size. Or...

comments.snippet: Should this be zooming opened connections as well as the mRemoteNG UI? If you have an RDP connection opened, should it be zoomed?
comments.author: sparerd

comments.snippet:
> Should this be zooming opened connections as well as the mRemoteNG UI?

Only opened connections. That's what I want to show.

> If you have an RDP connection opened, should it be zoomed?

Good question, I never used RDP, but I think it shouldn't be zoomed. If I demo something with RDP and it's too small to see I'd better use the native tools on the remote desktop to make them bigger.
comments.author: ruslanbes

comments.snippet: Ah ok, so in your case you would like this more for console-based connections like SSH?
comments.author: sparerd

comments.snippet: @sparerd yes, exactly. That's why I suggested it as simply increasing font size
comments.author: ruslanbes
